Name: last_updated_at
Computation Approach: ** Set to `provider.time.fleeti_time` when packet is received
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when Fleeti backend last received any telemetry packet from this asset. Indicates telemetry freshness. Used for connectivity status computation and "last contact" displays. Same value as `provider.time.fleeti_time`.

Name: asset_id
Description: Primary asset identifier

Name: asset_name
Description: Human-friendly asset label

Name: asset_type
Description: Type enum (vehicle, equipment, site, phone)

Name: asset_subtype
Description: Subtype enum (car, truck, cold_room, etc.)

Name: asset_group_id
Description: Primary group identifier

Name: asset_group_name
Description: Primary group name

Name: asset_customer_ref
Description: Reference code identifying the customer/tenant (e.g., `2010-010`)

Name: asset_accessories_id
Description: Unique accessory identifier

Name: asset_accessories_type_id
Description: Accessory type numeric ID

Name: asset_accessories_type_code
Description: Accessory type code (immobilizer, temperature, fuel_level, etc.)

Name: asset_accessories_connection
Description: Connection type (wire, bluetooth, wifi)

Name: asset_accessories_label
Description: Human-readable accessory label

Name: asset_installation_ignition_input_number
Description: Digital input wired to ignition switch

Name: asset_installation_immobilizer_output_number
Description: Digital output controlling immobilizer relay

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_serial_number
Description: OEM/installer serial number

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_brand
Description: Vehicle manufacturer brand

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_model
Description: Vehicle model name

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_license_plate
Description: Registration plate displayed to users

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_vin
Description: Vehicle identification number (VIN) - **Metadata only, no Navixy AVL ID available**

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_powertrain_primary_energy
Description: Primary energy source (diesel/gasoline/electric/hybrid/CNG/LNG/hydrogen/other)

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_powertrain_fuel_tank_capacity
Description: Nominal fuel tank size - `{ value: number, unit: "l" }`

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_powertrain_battery_capacity
Description: Battery capacity (for electric/hybrid vehicles) - `{ value: number, unit: "kwh" }`

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_powertrain_theoretical_consumption
Description: Expected fuel consumption baseline - `{ value: number, unit: "l/100km" }`

Name: asset_properties_vehicle_powertrain_theoretical_consumption_kwh
Description: Expected energy consumption baseline - `{ value: number, unit: "kwh/100km" }`

Name: asset_properties_equipment_serial_number
Description: Equipment serial number

Name: asset_properties_equipment_brand
Description: Equipment manufacturer brand

Name: asset_properties_equipment_model
Description: Equipment model name

Name: asset_properties_equipment_rated_power
Description: Equipment rated power - `{ value: number, unit: "kw" }`

Name: asset_properties_equipment_energy_source
Description: Equipment energy source (diesel/electric/hybrid)

Name: asset_properties_phone_platform
Description: Mobile platform (ios/android/unknown)

Name: asset_properties_phone_platform_version
Description: Platform version (e.g., `17.2`)

Name: asset_properties_phone_employee_id
Description: Associated employee identifier (not yet available)

Name: asset_properties_phone_employee_name
Description: Associated employee name (not yet available)

Name: asset_properties_site_name
Description: Site name

Name: asset_properties_site_address_line1
Description: Address line 1

Name: asset_properties_site_address_city
Description: City name

Name: asset_properties_site_address_country
Description: Country code (ISO)

Name: asset_properties_site_location_latitude
Description: Site latitude for map display

Name: asset_properties_site_location_longitude
Description: Site longitude for map display

Name: asset_properties_site_surface
Description: Site surface area - `{ value: number, unit: "m2" }`

Name: asset_properties_site_capacity_units
Description: Site capacity (units depend on site type)

Name: asset_accessories_serial_number
Description: Accessory serial number

Name: asset_accessories_sensors
Description: Array of sensor types/positions this accessory exposes

Name: asset_installation_initial_odometer_value
Description: Odometer reading at time of installation (offset). Measured in kilometers.

Name: asset_installation_initial_odometer_unit
Description: Unit for odometer value (always "km")

Name: asset_installation_initial_odometer_last_updated_at
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `initial_odometer.value` was last updated. Used to track installation metadata changes and audit trail.

Name: asset_installation_initial_engine_hours_value
Description: Engine hours reading at time of installation (offset). Measured in hours.

Name: asset_installation_initial_engine_hours_unit
Description: Unit for engine hours value (always "h")

Name: asset_installation_initial_engine_hours_last_updated_at
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `initial_engine_hours.value` was last updated. Used to track installation metadata changes and audit trail.

Name: asset_properties_site_temperature_range
Description: Expected min/max temperature range (especially for cold rooms) - `{ min: { value: number, unit: "Â°C" }, max: { value: number, unit: "Â°C" } }`

Name: status_top_status
Description: Connectivity > Immobilization > Engine > Transit

Name: status_statuses
Description: Array of compatible status families with codes

Name: status_statuses_last_changed_at
Computation Approach: ** Backend compares current `code` with previous value for each status family
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when this status family's code last changed. Used to calculate duration of current status (e.g., "offline for 2h", "engine running since 10:30").

Name: geofences
Description: Current geofences the asset is inside

Name: trip_distance
Description: Trip Odometer value

Name: trip_duration
Description: Runtime since engine start

Name: nearby_assets_id
Description: List of Beacon IDs

Name: status_top_status_last_changed_at
Computation Approach: ** Backend compares current `code` with previous value
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when the top status code last changed. Used to calculate duration of current status state.

Name: trip
Description: Ongoing trip information (nullable)

Name: location
JSON Structure: """{"latitude": "decimal degrees (-90 to 90)", "longitude": "decimal degrees (-180 to 180)", "altitude": "meters above sea level", "heading": "degrees (0-359, 0=North)", "cardinal_direction": "string (N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW)", "geocoded_address": "string", "last_changed_at": "number", "precision": {"hdop": "decimal (-1 to 20, -1=unknown)", "pdop": "decimal", "fix_quality": "integer (0=no fix, 1=fix)", "satellites": "integer (0-32)"}}"""

Name: location_latitude
Description: Latitude in decimal degrees

Name: location_longitude
Description: Longitude in decimal degrees

Name: location_altitude
Description: Altitude in meters

Name: location_heading
Description: Heading in degrees (0-359)

Name: location_cardinal_direction
Description: Cardinal direction (N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW)

Name: location_geocoded_address
Description: Single string representation of the location

Name: location_last_changed_at
Computation Approach: ** Backend compares current position/heading with previous, using threshold to filter GPS jitter
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when location/heading last changed significantly (threshold applied to filter GPS noise). Used for dwell-time calculations and "parked since X" features.

Name: location_precision_fix_quality
Description: 0 - GNSS OFF 1 â€“ GNSS ON with fix 2 - GNSS ON without fix 3 - GNSS sleep 4 - GNSS ON with fix, invalid data

Name: location_precision_hdop
Description: Horizontal Dilution of Precision

Name: location_precision_pdop
Description: Position Dilution of Precision

Name: location_precision_satellites
Description: Number of satellites in fix

Name: connectivity_signal_level
Description: Value in range 1-5 Explanation

Name: connectivity_operator
Description: Currently used GSM Operator code

Name: connectivity_data_mode
Description: Used differently across models. Most commonly: GSM/LTE network mode / roaming status. Sometimes appears as "Data Mode" or network type indicator. Interpretation depends on device model and firmware version.

Name: connectivity_cell_id
Description: GSM base station ID

Name: connectivity_cell_lac
Description: Location Area Code (LAC). Depends on GSM operator. Provides unique number assigned to a set of base GSM stations. Used for cell tower identification.

Name: connectivity_sim_iccid
Description: Value of SIM ICCID, MSB

Name: motion_speed
Description: GNSS Speed
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_speed, obd_speed, avl_io_24, avl_io_37, avl_io_81, speed

Name: motion_instant_movement
Description: **REQUIRES CLARIFICATION:** Semantic distinction from `motion.is_moving` unclear. Both are boolean movement indicators. Need to confirm with Navixy/GPS provider: What does "Instant Movement" represent vs. standard Movement detection?

Name: motion_accelerometer_x
Description: X axis value

Name: motion_accelerometer_y
Description: Y axis value

Name: motion_accelerometer_z
Description: Z axis value

Name: motion_is_moving_value
Description: 0 â€“ Movement Off 1 â€“ Movement On

Name: motion_is_moving_last_changed_at
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `motion.is_moving.value` last changed. Used to show "vehicle stopped since X" and calculate dwell times.

Name: power_ignition
Description: Ignition state (on/off). Computed from multiple sources (ignition cable, CAN signals, RPM, or AVL combined sources). Used by status computation and business logic. Source priority: SSF Ignition (`avl_io_898`) > CAN ignition state > CAN engine state > AVL Ignition (`avl_io_239`).

Name: power_ignition_last_changed_at
Computation Approach: ** Backend compares current `ignition` value with previous
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `power.ignition` last changed. Used to show "ignition on since X", detect abnormal long ignition periods, and improve trip detection.

Name: power_low_voltage_battery_level
Description: Board/system battery level (%) â€“ 12V, 24V, etc.

Name: power_low_voltage_battery_charging
Description: 0 = not charging, 1 = charging (alternator / DC-DC)

Name: power_ev_traction_battery_level
Description: HV / drive battery SOC in %

Name: power_ev_charging_active
Computation Approach: ** `cable_plugged = true` AND `traction_battery.level` is increasing over time
Description: True when EV is actively charging (cable plugged AND battery level increasing). Note: Logic to be implemented in transformation pipeline based on battery level trend analysis.

Name: power_ev_charging_cable_plugged
Description: 0 = unplugged, 1 = plugged. Indicates charging cable is physically connected to the vehicle.

Name: power_ev_motor_active
Description: 0 = off, 1 = electric motor active

Name: power_ev_range_estimated_distance
Description: Remaining range on battery

Name: fuel_consumption_cumulative
Description: Total fuel consumed (cumulative). Measured in liters. Sources include CAN consumption, GPS-calculated fuel used, and counted fuel consumed.

Name: fuel_consumption_rate
Description: Fuel rate

Name: fuel_energy_cng_status
Description: CNG Status

Name: fuel_levels_value
Description: Fuel level measured by LLS sensor via RS232/RS485
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_fuel_1, can_fuel_litres, avl_io_390, obd_custom_fuel_litres, avl_io_201, avl_io_203, avl_io_210, avl_io_212, avl_io_234, avl_io_270, avl_io_273, avl_io_84, avl_io_89, ble_lls_level_1, ble_lls_level_2, fuel_level, lls_level_1, lls_level_2, lls_level_3, lls_level_4

Name: fuel_energy_fuel_type_code
Description: 0 Not available 1 Gasoline 2 Methanol 3 Ethanol 4 Diesel 5 LPG 6 CNG 7 Propane 8 Electric 9 Bifuel running Gasoline 1...

Name: counters_odometer
Description: Total Vehicle Mileage
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_mileage, can_mileage_relative, avl_io_389, obd_custom_odometer, avl_io_105, avl_io_16, avl_io_87, hw_mileage, raw_mileage

Name: counters_engine_hours
Description: Total engine work time. Unit conversion may be required (some sources in seconds, others in hours).

Name: driving_behavior_brake_active
Description: 0 - Footbrake inactive 1 - Footbrake active

Name: driving_behavior_throttle_position
Description: Throttle position

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_driving_duration
Description: **Computed:** Cumulative time when the vehicle was actually moving (not just ignition on). Computed by backend based on motion data. Full implementation details will be documented in dedicated pages.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_idling_duration
Description: **Computed:** Cumulative time when the vehicle was idling (ignition on, not moving). Full implementation details and thresholds will be documented in dedicated pages.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_event_counts_excessive_idling
Description: **Computed:** Count of excessive idling events. The "excessive" threshold is configurable (for example, idling longer than X minutes). Full implementation details will be documented in dedicated pages.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_event_counts_harsh_acceleration
Description: **Computed:** Number of harsh acceleration events. Device and/or backend detect harsh accelerations based on thresholds and aggregate the count for the period. Detailed logic will be documented separately.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_event_counts_harsh_braking
Description: **Computed:** Number of harsh braking events aggregated over the period. Full threshold and detection logic will be documented in dedicated pages.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_event_counts_harsh_cornering
Description: **Computed:** Number of harsh cornering events aggregated over the period. Full threshold and detection logic will be documented in dedicated pages.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_event_counts_overspeed
Description: **Computed:** Number of overspeed events. Definition of overspeed (vehicle-specific limits vs. road-speed limits) is being finalized. Implementation details will be documented in dedicated pages.

Name: driving_behavior_daily_summary_eco_score_value
Description: Eco-driving score value reported by device firmware (averaged events per distance).

Name: sensors_environment_id
Description: Sensor identifier (e.g., Dallas sensor ID). Identity metadata is also derived from `asset.accessories[].sensors[]` (Section 1).

Name: sensors_environment_temperature
Description: Temperature readings from LLS, BLE, Dallas, and external sensors. Measured in degrees Celsius.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): avl_io_202, avl_io_204, avl_io_25, avl_io_26, avl_io_27, avl_io_28, avl_io_72, avl_io_73, ble_temp_sensor_1, ble_temp_sensor_2, ble_temp_sensor_3, ble_temp_sensor_4, ext_temp_sensor_1, ext_temp_sensor_2, ext_temp_sensor_3, lls_temperature_1, lls_temperature_2, temp_sensor

Name: sensors_environment_humidity
Description: Relative humidity readings from environmental sensors (BLE probes, LLS/external humidity sensors, or other accessories). Measured in percent (%).
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): avl_io_86, avl_io_104, avl_io_106, avl_io_108, ble_humidity_1, ble_humidity_2, ble_humidity_3, ble_humidity_4, humidity_1, humidity_2

Name: sensors_environment_battery
Description: Battery level of BLE environmental sensors. Measured in percentage.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): avl_io_20, avl_io_22, avl_io_23, ble_battery_level_2, ble_battery_level_3, ble_battery_level_4

Name: sensors_environment_frequency
Description: Frequency readings from BLE sensors. Measured in Hz.

Name: sensors_magnet_value
Description: Magnetic field sensor readings. Value represents sensor state (typically 0 = no magnetic field detected, 1 = magnetic field detected). Used for door/window position detection or security applications.

Name: sensors_inertial_pitch
Description: Pitch angle from inertial sensors. Measured in degrees.

Name: sensors_inertial_roll
Description: Roll angle from inertial sensors. Measured in degrees.

Name: sensors_custom_values
Description: Custom IO element values from BLE sensors. Can be numeric or string depending on sensor configuration.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): avl_io_331, avl_io_332, avl_io_333, avl_io_463, avl_io_464, avl_io_465, avl_io_466, avl_io_467, avl_io_468, avl_io_469, avl_io_470, avl_io_471, avl_io_472, avl_io_473

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_area_harvested
Description: Area of harvest in square meters

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_grain_moisture
Description: Grain moisture

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_grain_volume
Description: Mown volume

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_harvest_duration
Description: Duration of harvesting activity (agricultural CAN signal).

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_harvesting_drum_gap
Description: Gap under harvesting drum

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_harvesting_drum_rpm
Description: Harvesting drum rpm

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_mowing_efficiency
Description: Mowing efficiency

Name: diagnostics_agricultural_state_flags
Description: Agricultural machinery state flags (bitmask). Encodes various agricultural equipment states. Format: integer or hex depending on source.

Name: diagnostics_axles_weights
Description: Axle weight measurements. Each entry includes position (1-5) and weight in kg. Sources include CAN axle load signals and AVL IO parameters.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_axle_load_1, can_axle_load_2, can_axle_load_3, can_axle_load_4, can_axle_load_5, avl_io_118, avl_io_119, avl_io_120, avl_io_121, avl_io_122

Name: diagnostics_body_indicators_state_flags
Description: Vehicle indicator state flags (bitmask, Protocol 4). Encodes various indicator states (e.g. turn indicators, warning lamps). Format: integer or hex.

Name: diagnostics_body_indicators_cistern_state_flags
Description: Cistern/tank state flags (bitmask, Protocol 4). Encodes cistern-related equipment states. Format: integer or hex.

Name: diagnostics_body_occupancy_front_passenger
Description: 0 - Not present 1 - Present

Name: diagnostics_body_safety_airbag_state
Description: Airbag system state from CAN bus. Values: 0 = airbag system inactive/normal, 1 = airbag system active/warning. Indicates airbag system status and potential safety issues.

Name: diagnostics_body_climate_air_conditioning
Description: 0 - Off 1 - On

Name: diagnostics_brakes_abs_active
Description: CAN ABS State

Name: diagnostics_brakes_pad_wear
Description: Brake pad wear level from CAN bus. Measured in percentage (0-100%). Indicates remaining brake pad thickness. Lower values indicate more wear.

Name: diagnostics_brakes_parking_brake
Description: 0 - Handbrake inactive 1 - Handbrake active

Name: diagnostics_brakes_retarder_automatic
Description: CAN Automatic Retarder

Name: diagnostics_brakes_retarder_manual
Description: CAN Manual Retarder

Name: diagnostics_drivetrain_central_differential_4hi_locked
Description: CAN Central Diff 4HI Locked

Name: diagnostics_drivetrain_central_differential_4lo_locked
Description: CAN Central Diff 4LO Locked

Name: diagnostics_drivetrain_clutch_state
Description: CAN Clutch State

Name: diagnostics_drivetrain_cruise_control_active
Description: CAN Cruise Control

Name: diagnostics_drivetrain_front_differential_locked
Description: 0 - Unlocked 1 - Locked

Name: diagnostics_drivetrain_rear_differential_locked
Description: 0 - Unlocked 1 - Locked

Name: diagnostics_engine_coolant_temperature
Description: Engine coolant temperature from cooling system. Measured in degrees Celsius (Â°C).

Name: diagnostics_engine_glow_plug_active
Description: CAN Glow Plug Indicator

Name: diagnostics_engine_load
Description: Engine Load

Name: diagnostics_engine_pto_state
Description: CAN PTO State

Name: diagnostics_engine_ready_to_drive
Description: CAN Ready to Drive. Present on EV/hybrid and some modern ICE vehicles.

Name: diagnostics_engine_rpm
Description: Engine RPM

Name: diagnostics_engine_start_stop_inactive
Description: 0 - No 1 - Yes

Name: diagnostics_engine_temperature
Description: Engine Temperature

Name: diagnostics_engine_webasto_state
Description: CAN Webasto State

Name: diagnostics_engine_key_inserted
Description: 0 - No key in lock 1 - Key in lock

Name: diagnostics_fluids_adblue_level
Description: AdBlue/DEF fluid level. May be reported in liters or percentage depending on source.

Name: diagnostics_fluids_oil_pressure
Description: Engine oil pressure. Measured in kPa or psi depending on source.

Name: diagnostics_health_can_warning
Description: CAN bus warning indicator. Values: 0 = no warning, 1 = warning present. Indicates general CAN bus communication or system warnings detected by the vehicle's diagnostic system. Read from CAN bus.

Name: diagnostics_health_dtc_count
Description: Number of DTC

Name: diagnostics_health_electronics_power_control
Description: Electronics power control state from CAN bus. Values: 0 = normal operation, 1 = power control active. Indicates power management system status (e.g., power saving mode, normal operation, reduced power mode). Interpretation depends on vehicle manufacturer and model.

Name: diagnostics_health_battery_not_charging
Description: Battery not charging warning indicator. Values: 0 = off, 1 = on. Indicates that the low-voltage system battery is not being charged (alternator/DC-DC issue).

Name: diagnostics_health_low_fuel_warning
Description: Low fuel warning indicator from CAN bus. Values: 0 = normal, 1 = low fuel warning.

Name: diagnostics_health_low_oil_warning
Description: Low engine oil level warning indicator. Values: 0 = normal, 1 = low oil warning.

Name: diagnostics_health_low_tire_pressure_warning
Description: 0 - Off 1 - On

Name: diagnostics_health_mil_activated_distance
Description: Distance traveled with MIL (Malfunction Indicator Lamp) activated. Measured in kilometers (km). Indicates how far the vehicle has traveled since the MIL was triggered.

Name: diagnostics_health_mil_status
Description: Malfunction Indicator Lamp (MIL) status from OBD. Values depend on OBD protocol version. Typically: 0 = MIL off (no faults), 1 = MIL on (fault detected). Related to DTC count (`diagnostics.health.dtc_count`). When MIL is on, diagnostic trouble codes are present and should be checked.

Name: diagnostics_security_state_flags
Description: Security system state flags (bitmask). Encodes security-related states. Format: integer or hex depending on source.

Name: diagnostics_security_immobilizer_engine_lock_active
Description: Engine lock active status. Values: 0 = inactive, 1 = active. Indicates whether the engine is currently locked by the immobilizer system. Used for immobilization status computation.

Name: diagnostics_security_immobilizer_request_lock_engine
Description: Request to lock engine status. Values: 0 = off, 1 = on. Indicates a request/command to lock the engine has been sent. Used for immobilization status computation.

Name: diagnostics_systems_steering_eps_state
Description: Electric Power Steering (EPS) system state. Values: 0 = inactive/normal, 1 = active/warning. Indicates EPS system operational status. When active, the EPS system is engaged and assisting steering. Warning state may indicate system faults or reduced assistance. Read from CAN bus.

Name: diagnostics_systems_control_state_flags
Description: Vehicle control system state flags (bitmask). Encodes control system states. Format: integer or hex depending on source.

Name: diagnostics_systems_utility_state_flags
Description: Utility vehicle/equipment state flags (bitmask, Protocol 4). Encodes utility equipment states. Format: integer or hex.

Name: diagnostics_body_belts_*
Description: Seatbelt fastening status for driver, passenger, and rear seats (left, right, centre). Values: 0 = not fastened, 1 = fastened.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_rear_centre_seat_belt_state, can_rear_left_seat_belt_state, can_rear_right_seat_belt_state, can_seat_belt_driver_state, can_seat_belt_passenger_state, avl_io_940, avl_io_941, avl_io_942, avl_io_943, avl_io_944

Name: diagnostics_body_doors_*
Description: Door/hatch/cover open/closed status. Includes front doors (left, right), rear doors (left, right), trunk, hood, roof, and engine cover. Values: 0 = closed, 1 = open.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_door_state, can_front_left_door, can_front_right_door, can_hood_state, can_rear_left_door, can_rear_right_door, can_roof_state, can_trunk_state, avl_io_90, avl_io_654, avl_io_655, avl_io_656, avl_io_657, avl_io_658, avl_io_913

Name: diagnostics_body_lights_*
Description: Vehicle lighting system status. Includes headlights (dipped, full beam), fog lights (front, rear, additional), parking lights, light signal, and lights failure indicator. Values: 0 = off, 1 = on.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): can_additional_front_fog_lights, can_additional_rear_lights, can_dipped_headlights, can_front_fog_lights, can_full_beam_headlights, can_light_signal, can_lights_failure, can_parking_lights, can_rear_fog_lights, avl_io_935

Name: diagnostics_engine_running_value
Description: Engine actually running (motor state). Note: This is diagnostic data; may differ from `power.ignition` if ignition cable is not connected to motor level.

Name: diagnostics_engine_running_last_changed_at
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `diagnostics.engine.running.value` last changed. Used to calculate true engine running duration (vs ignition on), important for fuel consumption and maintenance tracking.

Name: diagnostics_systems_trailer_axle_lift_active
Description: Trailer axle lift active status. Array of boolean values, one per trailer axle. Values: false = axle down (normal position), true = axle lifted. Used for load distribution control and to reduce wear on specific axles when trailer is empty or lightly loaded. Read from CAN bus.

Name: io_inputs_individual_input_1
Description: Digital input 1 state. Values: 0 = low/inactive, 1 = high/active. Semantic meaning (e.g., ignition, door sensor) is defined in `asset.installation.*` metadata. Used to compute canonical fields like `power.ignition`. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 0.

Name: io_inputs_individual_input_2
Description: Digital input 2 state. Values: 0 = low/inactive, 1 = high/active. Semantic meaning defined in installation metadata. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 1.

Name: io_inputs_individual_input_3
Description: Digital input 3 state. Values: 0 = low/inactive, 1 = high/active. Semantic meaning defined in installation metadata. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 2.

Name: io_inputs_individual_input_4
Description: Digital input 4 state (also functions as pulse counter). Values: 0 = low/inactive, 1 = high/active. Pulse count resets when records are saved. Semantic meaning defined in installation metadata. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 3.

Name: io_outputs_individual_output_1
Description: Digital output 1 state. Values: 0 = inactive, 1 = active. Semantic meaning (e.g., immobilizer relay) is defined in `asset.installation.*` metadata. Used for immobilization control and status computation. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 0.

Name: io_outputs_individual_output_2
Description: Digital output 2 state. Values: 0 = inactive, 1 = active. Semantic meaning defined in installation metadata. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 1.

Name: io_outputs_individual_output_3
Description: Digital output 3 state. Values: 0 = inactive, 1 = active. Semantic meaning defined in installation metadata. If only bitmask is available, transformation pipeline extracts bit 2.

Name: io_analog_input_1
Description: Analog input 1 voltage reading. Measured in volts (V). Prefer `avl_io_9` over generic `adc` when available. Semantic meaning (e.g., fuel level sensor, temperature probe) is defined in installation metadata. Used to compute canonical sensor/fluid fields.

Name: io_analog_input_2
Description: Analog input 2 voltage reading. Measured in volts (V). Prefer `avl_io_6` over generic `adc` when available. Semantic meaning defined in installation metadata. Used to compute canonical sensor/fluid fields.

Name: driver_name
Description: Driver name from catalog. `null` if hardware key is not found in catalog (unknown driver).

Name: driver_authorization_state
Description: iButton connection status in immobilizer context. Values: 0 = iButton not connected, 1 = iButton connected (Immobilizer active), 2 = iButton connected (Authorized Driving). Note: Field name is "Immobilizer" but represents iButton authorization state.

Name: driver_hardware_key_value
Description: Hardware key identifier as hex string. Can be iButton or RFID code. Backend determines key type based on device model and signal characteristics. Used to lookup driver in Fleeti catalog.

Name: driver_hardware_key_extended_id
Description: MAC address of NMEA receiver device connected via Bluetooth. Usefulness for driver identification is still being evaluated (TBD). May be `null` if not available.

Name: driver_id_value
Description: Fleeti driver ID from catalog. `null` if hardware key is not found in catalog (unknown driver).

Name: driver_id_last_changed_at
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `driver.id.value` last changed. Used to show driver-vehicle association timeline and determine which driver was responsible at time of events.

Name: driver_privacy_mode_value
Description: Private mode state. Values: 0 = Private mode off, 1 = Private mode on. Driver setting that indicates whether the driver has activated private/work mode.

Name: driver_privacy_mode_last_changed_at
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `driver.privacy_mode.value` last changed. Used to show "private mode active since X" and separate private vs business time in reports.

Name: device_battery_current
Description: Device internal battery current. Measured in amperes (A).

Name: device_battery_level
Description: Device internal battery capacity level. Measured in percentage (0-100%).

Name: device_battery_voltage
Description: Device internal battery voltage. Measured in volts (V).

Name: device_bluetooth_status
Description: Bluetooth connection status. Values: 0 = BT disabled, 1 = BT enabled (no device connected), 2 = Device connected (BTv3 only), 3 = Device connected (BLE only), 4 = Device connected (BLE + BT).

Name: device_power_board_voltage
Description: External power supply voltage from board voltage reading. Measured in volts (V).

Name: device_power_connected
Description: External power supply connection status. Values: false = not connected, true = connected.

Name: device_power_external_voltage
Description: External power supply voltage from AVL IO parameter. Measured in volts (V). Note: May represent the same measurement as `board_voltage` but from a different source.

Name: device_sleep_mode
Description: Device sleep mode status. Values: 0 = No sleep, 1 = GPS sleep, 2 = Deep sleep, 3 = Online sleep, 4 = Ultra sleep.

Name: device_status_bitmap
Description: Device status bitmap. Contains device status flags and state information encoded as integer bits. Specific bit meanings depend on device model and firmware version.

Name: device_firmware_version
Description: Device firmware version identifier. Also represents CAN program/profile ID used by LV-CAN/ALL-CAN adapters to decode vehicle signals.

Name: device_identification_module_id_17b
Description: Device module identifier (17 bytes, hex string). Unique device hardware identifier.

Name: device_identification_module_id_8b
Description: Device module identifier (8 bytes, hex string). Unique device hardware identifier.

Name: other_events_device_unplugged
Description: Device battery unplugged event. Values: 0 = battery present, 1 = battery unplugged.

Name: other_events_eco_driving_daily_value
Description: **Computed:** Daily eco-driving score contribution used for dashboards/reports. Mirrors device-reported eco behavior value when provided.

Name: other_events_eco_driving_event_duration
Description: Duration (ms) of the detected green-driving event that contributed to the eco score.

Name: other_events_eco_driving_green_driving_type
Description: Encodes which harsh driving dimension triggered the eco event: 1 = harsh acceleration, 2 = harsh braking, 3 = harsh cornering.

Name: other_events_eco_driving_green_driving_value
Description: Magnitude of the green-driving event (e.g., g-force * 100). Used with `green_driving_type` to qualify the event.

Name: other_events_harsh_acceleration_force
Description: Harsh acceleration force measurement.

Name: other_events_harsh_braking_force
Description: Harsh braking force measurement.

Name: other_events_harsh_cornering_force
Description: Harsh cornering force measurement.

Name: other_events_harsh_cornering_radius
Description: Cornering radius measurement.

Name: other_events_idling
Description: Idling event status. Values: 0 = moving, 1 = idling.

Name: other_events_towing
Description: Towing detection event.

Name: other_events_trip
Description: Trip status. Values: 0 = trip stop, 1 = trip start. From firmware 01.00.24: 2 = Business Status, 3 = Private Status, 4-9 = Custom Statuses.

Name: other_geofence_auto_status
Description: Auto geofence status. Values: 0 = target left zone, 1 = target entered zone.

Name: other_geofence_zone_id
Description: Device-side geofence zone ID. Values: 0 = target left zone, 1 = target entered zone, 2 = over speeding end, 3 = over speeding start.

Name: other_geofence_device_zones_inside
Description: Device-side geofence zone status. Values: 0 = target left zone, 1 = target entered zone, 2 = over speeding end, 3 = over speeding start. Note: Geofence context is computed server-side and appears in Section 2 (Telemetry Context).

Name: other_impulse_counters
Description: Impulse/pulse counters from digital inputs. **Not cumulative counters** (unlike odometer/engine_hours). Counts pulses on digital inputs and resets when records are saved. Meaning depends on what sensor/device is wired to the input (defined in installation metadata). May represent frequency measurements or event counts. **Clarification needed:** Specific purpose TBD based on installation configuration.

Name: other_raw_can
Description: Raw CAN bus data. Unprocessed CAN messages. Interpretation and mapping to semantic fields will be defined in a future specification.
ðŸ’½ Provider Field (db): raw_can_1, raw_can_3, raw_can_8, raw_can_9, raw_can_11, raw_can_14, raw_can_15, raw_can_16, raw_can_17

Name: provider_event
Description: Event

Name: provider_event_code
Description: Event Code

Name: provider_event_subcode
Description: Sub Event Code

Name: provider_time_device_time
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) from device. Raw device timestamp from telemetry packet.

Name: provider_time_provider_time
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) from provider. Provider server timestamp when packet was received.

Name: provider_time_fleeti_time
Computation Approach: ** Set to current server timestamp when packet is received by Fleeti backend
Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when Fleeti backend received this telemetry packet via Data Forwarding. This is the authoritative "Fleeti reception time" and is used as the source for root-level `last_updated_at`.
